relation: Intel GMA HD fully works. Got NVIDIA to work using bumblebee, vdpau for NVIDIA not supported due to limitations in xorg. HDMI not tested.
Spdif not tested, but shows up in alsamixer

textBeforeTable: For full specifications see the Asus U31SD specifications page. Specifications If you would like to edit this page please first view our Editing Guidelines. Editing This Page This page is just for discussing using Linux on the Asus U31SD. For a general discussion about this laptop you can visit the Asus U31SD page on LapWik. If you have the Asus U31SD and are running Linux on it please consider editing this page or adding a comment below with your compatibility details. By contributing you will help other people running this laptop or trying to make a decision on whether to buy it or not. This is a first edition of a guide to running Linux with the Asus U31SD laptop. Tested with ArchLinux 64-bit. Introduction Frej Author(s) Asus U31SD 0% (0) Unusable 0% (0) Poor 0% (0) Fair
textAfterTable: Sound Working Spdif not tested, but shows up in alsamixer Ethernet Working Wireless Working Bluetooth Not Tested USB Working Card Reader Working Webcam Not Tested Suspend Working Tweaks needed, see notes Notes Tested with archlinux. Suspend does not work out of the box due to problems with the usb buses, they need to be disabled before going to sleep. Guide: http://thecodecentral.com/2011/01/18/fix-ubuntu-10-10-suspendhibernate-not-working-bug Passing pcie_aspm=force i915.i915_enable_rc6=1 to the kernel (3.0) will decrease power consumption. The NVIDIA card is possible to turn off using acpi_call but this is considered highly experimental at the moment (may mess up your BIOS) but it seems to work for me (use at your own risk). Summary This laptop runs quite well with linux, but tweaks are needed to get the power consumption down and suspend to work.
